places_with_reviews.name: Auli Hill Station
places_with_reviews.address: GHH7+CF3, Auli Laga Salude, Uttarakhand 246443, India

reviews.text: Auli is a place for tourist attraction. The view of the place surrounded by mountains with snow are spectacular. Rope way service by government is very convenient, plus people love hiking can also do hiking here. Snow season of auli is one of the best thing you will ever experience. You can do many adventures here like sking and many more. The only con of the place is that it is quiet expensive here, food items are expensive in comparison to the market area that's it. But you should definitely visit the place with your family and friends. Auli is best for picnic and holidays.

Its a magical place .We went in March end. It was little snow, misty slightly cold but breath taking. There's a trekking route to go up the mountains. Pahadon ki Maggie hits different ♥️
It was a beautiful experience.
It's the Switzerland of Uttarakhand & dream place for many travellers. Snow activity and ropeway is most popular here. Auli travel is life time experience for yourself ☃️⛄🏔️

Auli is one of the place where you should visit once in a lifetime . But during winters .
I visited auli during December time and my experience was too great. What a adventure trip was. I went there by own car till skiing Resort Auli. Enjoyed the view of snow covered peak with artificial lake. We spent lots of time playing in snow, Had experience fresh snow in morning a superb place for nature lover must visit place.❄️☃️

The beauty and the charm this place holds is something not to miss.
Atmosphere, Altitude, Views: sunrise, sunset, open sky or the shining star-ry sky makes it nothing less than heaven.
Must visit once and the ice sport provider shop near the pond is best for all your needs🔱☄️
Awesome  please like heaven. I always feel everyday "I am in Devbhoomi".

The Gateway of Badrinath, Valley of Flowers, Hemkund_Sahib, and many treaking destination...lots of memories from here not because it's a tourist destination it's because of MY HOMETOWN.. Since childhood I wandering in the street of jyotrimath.❣️ Tourist who will come to this beautiful place please maintain the hygiene here bcz your a small step can make a big change..❄️❣️
This is the Narshima Temple. The place is beautiful and must visit. The temple also has a view of elephant mountain. We were blessed to get morning arti and lord's blessings...

Beautiful place which is on the way to badrinath, hemkund sahib and valley of flowers........there is a kalpvruksh which is 2000 years old where adi shankarachary practice tsposadhna!. Place is surrounded by the hills and mountains.....one can experience snow mountains if the atmosphere is clear.
Road leading to Badrinath is good till Joshimath. After this around 80% of the patch is under construction and by 2025 you’ll find a smooth road between Joshimath and Badrinath too.

Desi Roshan place you should go in winter and winters every very peaceful quiet and so much of snow activities you can do and you can always go with friends family and as many as people you can go make sure you have all your coach with you as is too cold or their make sure you have all your warm clothes with you

Very beautiful place just like heaven. Cold winds are blowing constantly. Skiing resorts are there.But I will recommend to stay in Joshimath  because in the night there is no rope way service and there is no doctors so if your health will be unwell You cant do nothing.
Oh, what a weekend trip… was a bit tiring from delhi… but the views notched it off… must visit Narsingh Narain Mandir…
Sometimes the most productive thing you can do is relax and enjoy the serene beauty of mother nature. Joshimath has them all.
Really a Switzerland of India. U can't imagine a white cover of all over the hills . We enjoyed with snow and snow fall.

places_with_reviews.name: Shri Narsingh Temple, Joshimath
places_with_reviews.address: HH48+HFQ, Narsingh Mandir Marg, Joshimath, Uttarakhand 246443, India

reviews.text:
Near this temple dharamshala named with yatri niwas.
I have given photo of this dharamshala.
Cost for 4 people was 600 only.
Best place to stay in joshimath.
Room was very clean, beautiful,bed is very well.
It just beside this temple.
You have to go down from traveller car parking.
5 min drive by car.
One of the most calming and peaceful temples I have been to. With the Haathi Parvat at the backdrop and some snow clad Himalayan Peaks! The story behind the temple is a must hear!

Narshima temple establishment done by shankaracharya some thousand years ago
Temple was newly built in 2018
Where badrinath temple when closed people come here for darshan till May when the temple is re-open
It had a peaceful look and feel
Also do see the shankaracharya gaadi nearby building where the lathi is kept when badrinath is closed

This temple is at Joshimath/ Jyotirmath in the midst of the sky touching mountains and valleys, also known as Winter Badrinath
It is to be said that Rishi Shankracharya Ji laid the foundation of this in the 8th Century.

Absolutely worthy religious place
A temple dedicated to Bhagwan Narsingh is situated in Joshimath of Uttarakhand. Must visit if you ever go to Auli or nearby places

places_with_reviews.name: Auli Skiing School
places_with_reviews.address: Auli Rd, Auli Laga Salude, Uttarakhand 246443, India

reviews.text:
In case Snowing, or Snow fall has occurred before you visit this place, in that case the experience is like visiting Heaven. This is one of the best tourist destination within India, which is having best views, best environment, best Skiing Facilities Created in India, and a Skiing Training Program within India.

GMVN (Gadwal Mandal Vikas Nigam) is having it's Facilities / Resort to stay and the team is doing it's best to provide best possible service within their reach.

For us it was a three night experience delight and one of the finest experience of my life. I have seen half of the Uttarakhand and this was my seventh long trip to Uttarakhand, and every expedition was wonderful, but the Trip to Auli was the best.

I strongly recommend this place, and best month/ time to visit is December, January, February.

Beautiful place to visit in Jan-Feb Or in March.
Check if there is snow or not. Must try Cahircar to head towards top of the hills. Take a guide (1000 ₹). You can view all the mountains around from the top. Can have maggie & momos & tea on the top of the hills.
I have not been for the Training. But this is one of the most popular Skiing Training Center, Fully Equipped, and conducting International Skiing Competition at Auli.

They cater for all levels, skiing and snowboarding.
Not all difficult runs. Great family holiday.
Like it great view. Clean air . Your life will be increased by 10 years. You would become disease free. You 💓 will become strong.
Beautiful temple of Bhagwan Visnhu-Narayan on the sangam of two rivers.

This spiritual place is located on the way to Badrinath from joshimath before givind ghat.
It is the first of 5 alaknanda prayags between alakananda from satopanth glacier which flows through Badrinath and dhauliganga from niti pass near Tibet border.
While going to Badrinath you can see the sangam on the right after crossing bridge over alaknanda river.
Sangam place where River Alakananda and River Dhauli Ganga join. Beautiful place to visit when you travel from Rishikesh to Badrinath
What a mesmerizing view of sangam. Both the river having different colours of water. You can amazing.

Vishnuprayag is one of the Panch Prayag (five confluences) of Alaknanda River, and lies at the confluence of Alaknanda River and Dhauliganga River. Nice location. Sivji & visnu temple is also near the sangam. Nearly road side parking is available you can park your vehicle easily.

places_with_reviews.name: Artificial Lake Auli
places_with_reviews.address: GHH7+F9, Auli Laga Salude, Uttarakhand 246443, India

reviews.text:
Auli truly embodies the essence of paradise with its breathtaking views of the majestic Himalayas and snow-covered peaks. At the heart of this heavenly destination lies an artificial lake, which, although currently dried out, still captivates visitors with its serene surroundings. While snowfall may limit activities near the lake, there are a few shops offering food for sustenance also mule ride towards the top.

For those planning to explore the area, the rope way operates from 9 am to 5 pm, with a lunch break from 1 pm to 2 pm. It's advisable to carry heavy winter clothing, especially if traveling in winter, to stay warm in the chilly weather.
Auli is a heaven on earth, spectacular views of mighty Himalayas, snow covered peaks and this artificial lake stands right at the center of this heaven.

Currently lake is dried out and due to snowfall not much activity near to lake. There few shops who serve food. Rope way is opened 9 am to 5 pm lunch timing 1 pm to 2 pm. If traveling with toddlers carry heavy winter ❄️ clothing.
3 months when it has snowfall, one should plan and visit.
Visited on 14 march. Very beautiful views of mountains range

places_with_reviews.name: Gorson Bugyal
places_with_reviews.address: GH67+J67, Auli Laga Salude, Uttarakhand 246443, India

reviews.text:
Mild to moderate difficult  trek but snow made it challenging to climb but the view from the top is Beautiful 😀
March is a great season as snow starts melting and the path is open for trekking!

Gorson Bugyal in Auli offers a spellbinding experience with its distinctive sunrise and sunset over snow-capped mountains. The trek unveils a picturesque track, transitioning from lush greenery to panoramic views. The sunrise paints the peaks in hues of pink and gold, while the sunset bids farewell with a warm, mesmerizing glow. Gorson Bugyal is a symphony of nature, blending serene meadows with majestic snow-capped peaks, creating an unforgettable retreat into untouched beauty.

(We went on Christmas, so snow was till ankle)

Best time to visit, after Christmas to Feb, ( Snow can get as much as till knees) traffic was high so reach as early as possible to avoid queues and rush while returning.

Things to brings, snacks/shops are available still you can bring your own

Trekking, 2 hour long moderate difficulty trekking, bring your own trekking gear, however for snow activities, you will be provided required equipments.

If you do not want to trek to reach at top, use rope way, (up/down included) rate ~500/person, (rope way timings are strict and need to follow, you would get ~4 hours up there before you need to return) then ride mule (up/down included, 30 min each way) to reach top, rates depends on traffic.

As sun ☀️ goes down and windy weather, cold will increase exponentially, bring warm clothes and do preparations accordingly.
A good place to see sunrise and a great experience for trek lovers like me

Spellbound by this place. The views here are unbelievable. It's an underrated destination as of now. Visit here before it gets crowded with tourist traffic. Must visit if you are travelling in Uttrakhand. You get the Swiss Alps experience right here in India.  You can either trek or take a horse ride. It's a pretty long trek to the best spot.

The Amnaya of Shankaracharya in the North.Raja Rajeswari is the main Deity. Very beautiful Mutt with the only kalpaka vruksham in the Bhu loka. The spatika linga was given by Adishankara and thotakacharya kuufa is very special. Not to be missed in Dev bhumi.

Narasimha Swamy temple is located here. Badrinath Uthsavamurthi resides here when Badrinath is closed for 6 months. This temple is one of 108 Divyadesams. It was nicely developed today. Adi Shankaracharya did Thapas under a Mulberry tree which has become very very large. Totakacharya, one of four main disciples of Sankar acharya established here, one Matha. One can observe many such places here. We saw here, Sankarachaarya's gadde (peetham) in Narasimha Swami temple.
It's a very peaceful and ancient temple at Joshimath.  If, you are planning/going not to badrinath directly, My suggestion, please must visit here.

Its a must visit for all Hindu's. This is the 1 of 4 math's established by Adi Shankaracharya. We were lucky to have a guruji there whoexplained lot of things and allowed us to click pics. It's next to Kalpravrikrsha and Narsingh temple is also not very far. Don't go walking as it is on a hillock... cars go close to this temple.
Beautiful temple and a beautiful road leading upto the temple. We spent a good amount of time here. It's so calm, so serene, you can actually spend a whole day here.

places_with_reviews.name: Adi Shankaracharya temple Jyotirmath
places_with_reviews.address: Way to, HH46+495, Way to Manohar Bagh, Joshimath, Uttarakhand 246443, India

reviews.text:
Adi shankracharya temple at Joshimath. The distance of Joshimath from Haridwar is 275 km, Shrinagar is 148 km, Chamoli is 5 km. Joshimath is a pilgrim center in between Kedarnath Dham  & Badrinath Dham. We have been preceded by the Alto 800 car via Ukhimath, chopta Hill Station & Joshimath on 26.9.23 i.e. in slack season. Accommodation & food facilities are available as usual at the normal rate.
This math is established by Shri jagadguru Adi Shankracharya. Formar is called Jyotirmath. Jyotirmath is among the four math. A Laxminarayan temple, idols of Badrinarayan, Raj Rajeshwari Devi is beautifully located  inside the temple. Nowadays Jyotirmath becomes the mystic land of Uttarakhand. Best time April to Nov.
Totakacharya cave exists in the Adi Shankaracharya Math. Totakacharya, the discipline of Adi Shankracharya had meditated. Adi shankracharya wanted to require  a boy named Giri for his loyalty & devotion. Giri has knowledge of all shastra. This humble discipline Giri becomes Totakacharya.

Shankaracharya Math in Joshimath, Uttarakhand, is not just a temple; it is a spiritual haven that transcends time and place. Nestled in the embrace of the awe-inspiring Himalayan mountains, this sacred sanctuary is a must-visit for anyone seeking a profound connection with divinity, nature, and history.

From the moment you set foot in the vicinity of Shankaracharya Math, a deep sense of tranquility envelopes you. The lush greenery, pristine air, and the melodious hymns echoing through the surroundings create an atmosphere of pure serenity. The temple's architecture is a testament to the rich heritage of India, with its intricate carvings and the sanctity of the shrine resonating through every stone.

The spiritual experience offered here is unparalleled. The rhythmic chants of the priests and the fragrant incense infuse the air with an aura of devotion. Whether you are a devout follower of Hinduism or simply a seeker of inner peace, you will find a profound sense of connection with the divine amidst these hallowed walls.

What truly sets Shankaracharya Math apart is its location. Perched at an altitude that allows you to gaze upon the majestic peaks of the Himalayas, the views are nothing short of awe-inspiring. The ethereal beauty of the surroundings, especially during sunrise and sunset, is a sight that will etch itself into your memory forever.

The journey to reach this sacred spot might be challenging, but it is an essential part of the pilgrimage. As you make your way through the winding mountain roads, you'll find your soul getting closer to the heavens with every twist and turn.
Felt blessed to see future Kedarnath temple(Bhavisya Kedar mandir).A place to wish for something really wanted with Wish tree.
Calm nd quiet place.. The priest there was patient enough to narrate the whole history of this Matt to us
This is one of the 5 ashram founded by Adi sankaracharya. Very calm place. A holy tree is also near by. This place is suitable for only spiritual interested people.
